alert.note: Alert for Banner; Morrill (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 7:01PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Morrill and northeastern Banner Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 601 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Redington, or 25 miles southeast of Scottsbluff, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Morrill and northeastern Banner Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
